display.label: Mailchimp
display.description: Interact with email campaign lists and e-commerce resources.

inputs.comments: The OAuth 2.0 Authorization URL for Mailchimp
inputs.label: Authorize URL

inputs.comments: The OAuth 2.0 Token URL for Mailchimp
inputs.label: Token URL

inputs.comments: Mailchimp does not support granular scopes.
inputs.label: Scopes

connections.label: Mailchimp API Key
connections.comments: Authenticate requests to Mailchimp using an API Key

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the API Key.
inputs.label: API Key

documentation.description: This component can be configured to use an API Key to authenticate the request. An API key can be obtained by following Mailchimp's [quickstart guide](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/guides/quick-start/)

display.label: Ping
display.description: Send a ping to determine the status of the Mailchimp servers

display.label: List Campaigns
display.description: Get all campaigns in an account

inputs.comments: Provide an integer value for the maximum amount of results that will be returned. Provide a value from 1 to 1000.
inputs.label: Result Count

inputs.comments: Provide an integer value for the page offset for the given object's results.
inputs.label: Offset

display.label: Send Campaign
display.description: Send a Mailchimp campaign. For RSS Campaigns, the campaign will send according to its schedule. All other campaigns will send immediately.

inputs.comments: Provide a string value that represents the campaign Id.
inputs.label: Campaign Id

display.label: Get Member
display.description: Get information about a specific list member, including a currently subscribed, unsubscribed, or bounced member

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the Id of the list.
inputs.label: List Id

inputs.comments: The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list member's email address. This endpoint also accepts email addresses.
inputs.label: SubscriberHash

display.label: Delete Member
display.description: Delete all personally identifiable information related to a list member, and remove them from a list. This will make it impossible to re-import the list member

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the Id of the list.
inputs.label: List Id

inputs.comments: The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list member's email address. This endpoint also accepts email addresses.
inputs.label: SubscriberHash

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the Id of the list.

inputs.comments: Provide a string value that represents the email address.
inputs.label: Email

inputs.comments: The default language for this lists's forms.
inputs.label: Language

inputs.comments: Subscriber's current status. Possible values: "subscribed", "unsubscribed", "cleaned", "pending", or "transactional".
inputs.label: Status

inputs.comments: Type of email this member asked to get ('html' or 'text').
inputs.label: Email Type

inputs.comments: A dictionary of merge fields (audience fields) where the keys are the merge tags. For example, {"FNAME":"Freddie"}
inputs.label: Merge Fields

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the marketing permission Id
inputs.label: Marketing Permission Id

inputs.comments: The tags that are associated with a member.
inputs.label: Tags

inputs.comments: Provide a boolean value for the enabled field.
inputs.label: enabled

inputs.comments: The key of this object's properties is the Id of the interest in question.
inputs.label: Interests

inputs.comments: Provide a boolean to determine VIP status.
inputs.label: VIP

inputs.comments: Whether the list supports multiple formats for emails. When set to true, subscribers can choose whether they want to receive HTML or plain-text emails. When set to false, subscribers will receive HTML emails, with a plain-text alternative backup.

display.label: Raw Request
display.description: Send a raw HTTP request to Mailchimp API

inputs.comments: Input the path only (/reporting/facebook-ads), The base URL is already included (https://${dc}.api.mailchimp.com/3.0). For example, to connect to https://${dc}.api.mailchimp.com/3.0/reporting/facebook-ads, only /reporting/facebook-ads is entered in this field.
inputs.label: URL

inputs.comments: The HTTP method to use.
inputs.label: Method

inputs.comments: The HTTP body payload to send to the URL.
inputs.label: Data

inputs.comments: The Form Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: Form Data

inputs.comments: File Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: File Data

inputs.comments: A list of query parameters to send with the request. This is the portion at the end of the URL similar to ?key1=value1&key2=value2.
inputs.label: Query Parameter

inputs.comments: A list of headers to send with the request.
inputs.label: Header

inputs.comments: The type of data you expect in the response. You can request json, text, or binary data.
inputs.label: Response Type

inputs.comments: The maximum time that a client will await a response to its request
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: Enabling this flag will log out the current request.
inputs.label: Debug Request

inputs.comments: The delay in milliseconds between retries.
inputs.label: Retry Delay (ms)

inputs.comments: If true, retries on all erroneous responses regardless of type.
inputs.label: Retry On All Errors

inputs.comments: The maximum number of retries to attempt.
inputs.label: Max Retry Count

inputs.comments: Specifies whether to use a pre-defined exponential backoff strategy for retries.
inputs.label: Use Exponential Backoff

documentation.description:
[Mailchimp](https://www.mailchimp.com/) is a marketing automation platform and email marketing service.
The Mailchimp component allows you to interact with your mailchimp email campaigns and your e-commerce site.
documentation.dev:
You can configure a Mailchimp [webhook](https://mailchimp.com/developer/transactional/docs/webhooks/#add-a-new-webhook) to send information to a Prismatic webhook URL under certain conditions ("Profile Updates", "Subscribes", "Campaign Sending", etc.).

For more information on configuring webhooks refer to the [Mailchimp Docs](https://mailchimp.com/developer/transactional/docs/webhooks/)
